comment: love the app, but there are some things that are annoying. When you go back onto the homepage not too long after, your feed resets automatically, not being able to find the pins before it restarted, nothing. It's annoying because it automatically decides to refresh my page without me doing so and not being able to browse the pins I'd like. Pinterest also sent me several emails saying they've removed pins from my board and ones I've created, and doesn't show which pins or lets me send an appeal.
key sentence: Pinterest automatically refreshes the page without user intervention, making it difficult to browse the desired pins.
the function of activity: Activity involves searching, accessing menus, filtering, viewing various content categories, managing pins, profiles, settings, creating, sharing, and navigating within the interface.

comment: love the app, but there are some things that are annoying. When you go back onto the homepage not too long after, your feed resets automatically, not being able to find the pins before it restarted, nothing. It's annoying because it automatically decides to refresh my page without me doing so and not being able to browse the pins I'd like. Pinterest also sent me several emails saying they've removed pins from my board and ones I've created, and doesn't show which pins or lets me send an appeal.
scenarios: When you go back onto the homepage not too long after, your feed resets automatically, and you are not able to find the pins from before it restarted.
Pinterest automatically refreshes the page without user intervention, making it difficult to browse the desired pins.
Pinterest sends several emails saying they've removed pins from the user's board and ones the user has created, but does not show which pins or offer the option to send an appeal.
key sentence: Pinterest automatically refreshes the page without user intervention, making it difficult to browse the desired pins.
the function of activity: Activity involves searching, accessing menus, filtering, viewing various content categories, managing pins, profiles, settings, creating, sharing, and navigating within the interface.
the sub-task list of state: [{'name': 'Create', 'description': 'Tab for creating something'}, {'name': 'Notifications', 'description': 'Tab for viewing notifications'}, {'name': 'Saved', 'description': 'Tab for viewing saved items'}, {'name': 'Avatar: Jane', 'description': 'Display the avatar for the user Jane'}, {'name': 'Access Search Page', 'description': 'Access the search page.'}, {'name': 'Browse content', 'description': 'Browse recommended pins.'}]
